answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The numbness could be due to nerve compression. This is possible at various levels. It could be due to compression of the spinal nerves at the cervical spine level or, ulnar nerve at the elbow level. Hypothyroidism, diabetes, tumors and infections of the ulnar and spinal nerves and rheumatism can all cause numbness of little and ring finger.Please consult a neurologist. Take care!

question: my left pinky and ring finger is numb and1/2 of my hand, and when I use it to lift something up, like a pot of water it really gets numb, What could it be?
title: tingling figers
